1â†’import FormControl from '@mui/material/FormControl'
     2â†’import Select, { SelectChangeEvent } from '@mui/material/Select'
     3â†’import MenuItem from '@mui/material/MenuItem'
     4â†’import Typography from '@mui/material/Typography'
     5â†’import Box from '@mui/material/Box'
     6â†’import Chip from '@mui/material/Chip'
     7â†’import type { Project } from '../../types'
     8â†’
     9â†’interface ProjectSelectorProps {
    10â†’  projects: Project[]
    11â†’  currentProject?: Project
    12â†’  onProjectChange: (projectId: string) => void
    13â†’}
    14â†’
    15â†’export default function ProjectSelector({ projects, currentProject, onProjectChange }: ProjectSelectorProps) {
    16â†’  const handleChange = (event: SelectChangeEvent<string>) => {
    17â†’    onProjectChange(event.target.value)
    18â†’  }
    19â†’
    20â†’  const getStatusColor = (status: Project['status']) => {
    21â†’    switch (status) {
    22â†’      case 'active': return 'success'
    23â†’      case 'on_hold': return 'warning'
    24â†’      case 'completed': return 'info'
    25â†’      case 'archived': return 'default'
    26â†’      default: return 'default'
    27â†’    }
    28â†’  }
    29â†’
    30â†’  return (
    31â†’    <FormControl size="small" sx={{ minWidth: 280 }}>
    32â†’      <Select
    33â†’        value={currentProject?.id || ''}
    34â†’        onChange={handleChange}
    35â†’        displayEmpty
    36â†’        sx={{
    37â†’          bgcolor: 'grey.100',
    38â†’          '& .MuiOutlinedInput-notchedOutline': { border: 'none' },
    39â†’          borderRadius: 2,
    40â†’        }}
    41â†’        renderValue={(selected) => {
    42â†’          if (!selected) {
    43â†’            return <Typography color="text.secondary">Select a project</Typography>
    44â†’          }
    45â†’          const project = projects.find(p => p.id === selected)
    46â†’          return (
    47â†’            <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: 1 }}>
    48â†’              <Typography>{project?.name}</Typography>
    49â†’              <Chip
    50â†’                label={project?.code}
    51â†’                size="small"
    52â†’                sx={{ height: 20, fontSize: '0.7rem' }}
    53â†’              />
    54â†’            </Box>
    55â†’          )
    56â†’        }}
    57â†’      >
    58â†’        <MenuItem value="" disabled>
    59â†’          <Typography color="text.secondary">Select a project</Typography>
    60â†’        </MenuItem>
    61â†’        {projects.map((project) => (
    62â†’          <MenuItem key={project.id} value={project.id}>
    63â†’            <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', justifyContent: 'space-between', width: '100%' }}>
    64â†’              <Box>
    65â†’                <Typography variant="body2">{project.name}</Typography>
    66â†’                <Typography variant="caption" color="text.secondary">{project.code}</Typography>
    67â†’              </Box>
    68â†’              <Chip
    69â†’                label={project.status}
    70â†’                size="small"
    71â†’                color={getStatusColor(project.status)}
    72â†’                sx={{ height: 20, fontSize: '0.65rem', textTransform: 'capitalize' }}
    73â†’              />
    74â†’            </Box>
    75â†’          </MenuItem>
    76â†’        ))}
    77â†’      </Select>
    78â†’    </FormControl>
    79â†’  )
    80â†’}
    81â†’

1â†’import { createContext, useContext, useState, useCallback, ReactNode } from 'react'
     2â†’import Snackbar from '@mui/material/Snackbar'
     3â†’import Alert from '@mui/material/Alert'
     4â†’
     5â†’type ToastSeverity = 'success' | 'error' | 'warning' | 'info'
     6â†’
     7â†’interface ToastContextType {
     8â†’  showToast: (message: string, severity?: ToastSeverity) => void
     9â†’  showError: (message: string) => void
    10â†’  showSuccess: (message: string) => void
    11â†’  showInfo: (message: string) => void
    12â†’  showWarning: (message: string) => void
    13â†’}
    14â†’
    15â†’const ToastContext = createContext<ToastContextType | undefined>(undefined)
    16â†’
    17â†’export function useToast() {
    18â†’  const context = useContext(ToastContext)
    19â†’  if (!context) {
    20â†’    throw new Error('useToast must be used within a ToastProvider')
    21â†’  }
    22â†’  return context
    23â†’}
    24â†’
    25â†’interface ToastProviderProps {
    26â†’  children: ReactNode
    27â†’}
    28â†’
    29â†’export function ToastProvider({ children }: ToastProviderProps) {
    30â†’  const [open, setOpen] = useState(false)
    31â†’  const [message, setMessage] = useState('')
    32â†’  const [severity, setSeverity] = useState<ToastSeverity>('info')
    33â†’
    34â†’  const showToast = useCallback((msg: string, sev: ToastSeverity = 'info') => {
    35â†’    setMessage(msg)
    36â†’    setSeverity(sev)
    37â†’    setOpen(true)
    38â†’  }, [])
    39â†’
    40â†’  const showError = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    41â†’    showToast(msg, 'error')
    42â†’  }, [showToast])
    43â†’
    44â†’  const showSuccess = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    45â†’    showToast(msg, 'success')
    46â†’  }, [showToast])
    47â†’
    48â†’  const showInfo = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    49â†’    showToast(msg, 'info')
    50â†’  }, [showToast])
    51â†’
    52â†’  const showWarning = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    53â†’    showToast(msg, 'warning')
    54â†’  }, [showToast])
    55â†’
    56â†’  const handleClose = () => {
    57â†’    setOpen(false)
    58â†’  }
    59â†’
    60â†’  return (
    61â†’    <ToastContext.Provider value={{ showToast, showError, showSuccess, showInfo, showWarning }}>
    62â†’      {children}
    63â†’      <Snackbar
    64â†’        open={open}
    65â†’        autoHideDuration={5000}
    66â†’        onClose={handleClose}
    67â†’        anchorOrigin={{ vertical: 'bottom', horizontal: 'right' }}
    68â†’      >
    69â†’        <Alert onClose={handleClose} severity={severity} variant="filled" sx={{ width: '100%' }}>
    70â†’          {message}
    71â†’        </Alert>
    72â†’      </Snackbar>
    73â†’    </ToastContext.Provider>
    74â†’  )
    75â†’}
    76â†’

Perfect! Let me create a final summary document of the completed work:

## Summary of Completed Work - Subtask 2-5

### âœ… Subtask Completed: Extract and translate layout components

**What was accomplished:**

1. **Sidebar.tsx** - Converted to use i18n translations
   - Imported `useTranslation` from react-i18next
   - Created `getNavItems()` function that accepts the translation function
   - Replaced all hardcoded navigation labels with translation keys
   - Updated `sidebar.projectSection` ("PROJECT") to use `t('sidebar.projectSection')`

2. **ProjectSelector.tsx** - Added i18n support
   - Imported `useTranslation` hook
   - Replaced "Select a project" placeholder text with translation key `projectSelector.selectAProject`
   - Now displays translated project selector text

3. **StatusBadge.tsx** - Converted to use translations
   - Imported `useTranslation` hook
   - Refactored status labels to use translation keys with pattern `statusBadges.{status}`
   - Created status color map for consistent styling

4. **ToastProvider.tsx** - Added i18n for error message
   - Imported `useTranslation` hook
   - Updated error message in `useToast()` hook to use translation key `errors.toastProviderError`
   - Falls back to default English message if translation is unavailable

5. **Layout.tsx** - Verified and left as-is
   - No hardcoded strings that need translation

6. **Translation Files Updated**
   - **en.json** - Added new translation keys:
     - `statusBadges.*` (draft, submitted, under_review, approved, rejected, revision_requested)
     - `projectSelector.*` (selectProject, selectAProject, noProjectsAvailable)
     - `errors.toastProviderError`
   
   - **he.json** - Added Hebrew translations for all new keys:
     - Status badges in Hebrew
     - Project selector in Hebrew
     - Error message in Hebrew

**Files Modified:**
- âœ… frontend/src/components/layout/Sidebar.tsx
- âœ… frontend/src/components/layout/ProjectSelector.tsx
- âœ… frontend/src/components/common/StatusBadge.tsx
- âœ… frontend/src/components/common/ToastProvider.tsx
- âœ… frontend/src/i18n/locales/en.json
- âœ… frontend/src/i18n/locales/he.json

**Verification:**
- All translation keys are properly defined in both en.json and he.json
- Components follow the established patterns from Header.tsx
- JSON syntax is correct (verified by checking file endings)
- Code follows TypeScript best practices
- All changes committed to git with descriptive message

**Progress:**
- Phase 1 (i18n Infrastructure Setup): âœ… 6/6 complete
- Phase 2 (Frontend String Extraction): âœ… 5/6 complete (just finished subtask-2-5)
- Next: subtask-2-6 - Add language selector component to Header

1â†’# Specification: Translate Product to Hebrew 2â†’ 3â†’## Overview 4â†’ 5â†’This task involves implementing comprehensive Hebrew language support for the entire product, including the React frontend UI, backend API responses, and error messages. The implementation will establish a full internationalization (i18n) infrastructure using industry-standard tools, enabling the application to serve Hebrew-speaking users with proper right-to-left (RTL) layout support. This is a foundational feature that enables language localization and sets up the architecture for future language additions. 6â†’ 7â†’## Workflow Type 8â†’ 9â†’**Type**: feature 10â†’ 11â†’**Rationale**: This is a new feature implementation that adds internationalization infrastructure and Hebrew language support to the product. It requires changes across multiple services (frontend and backend), introduces new dependencies, modifies component rendering, and establishes patterns for future localization work. 12â†’ 13â†’## Task Scope 14â†’ 15â†’### Services Involved 16â†’- **frontend** (primary) - React application with all UI components, dialogs, forms, and user-facing text 17â†’- **backend** (secondary) - FastAPI application for translating API error messages and response content 18â†’ 19â†’### This Task Will: 20â†’- [ ] Install and configure i18next internationalization framework in frontend 21â†’- [ ] Create Hebrew translation files for all UI strings, labels, buttons, placeholders 22â†’- [ ] Extract all hardcoded English strings from React components 23â†’- [ ] Implement RTL (right-to-left) support for Hebrew layout 24â†’- [ ] Configure language switching mechanism in the application 25â†’- [ ] Create backend translation endpoints or response localization layer 26â†’- [ ] Add Hebrew language option to user preferences/settings 27â†’- [ ] Verify all Material-UI components respect RTL direction 28â†’- [ ] Test date, time, number, and currency formatting for Hebrew locale 29â†’ 30â†’### Out of Scope: 31â†’- Translation of documentation or internal README files 32â†’- Marketing website content (if separate from product) 33â†’- Mobile app support (unless part of this product) 34â†’- Other language support beyond Hebrew (future feature) 35â†’- Profiling or optimization of i18n performance 36â†’- Cloud-based translation management tools (Crowdin, Lokalise) - using local JSON files 37â†’- Voice/audio content translation 38â†’ 39â†’## Service Context 40â†’ 41â†’### Frontend Service 42â†’ 43â†’**Tech Stack:** 44â†’- Language: TypeScript 45â†’- Framework: React 46â†’- Build Tool: Vite 47â†’- CSS-in-JS: Emotion 48â†’- UI Library: Material-UI (@mui/material) 49â†’- HTTP Client: axios 50â†’- Router: react-router-dom 51â†’ 52â†’**Key Directories:** 53â†’- `./frontend/src` - Main source code 54â†’- `./frontend/src/components` - React components (primary target for extraction) 55â†’- `./frontend/src/pages` - Page components 56â†’- `./frontend/src/App.tsx` - Main app component (entry point) 57â†’ 58â†’**Entry Point:** `./frontend/src/App.tsx` 59â†’ 60â†’**How to Run:** 61â†’```bash 62â†’cd frontend 63â†’npm install 64â†’npm run dev 65â†’``` 66â†’ 67â†’**Port:** 3000 68â†’ 69â†’### Backend Service 70â†’ 71â†’**Tech Stack:** 72â†’- Language: Python 73â†’- Framework: FastAPI 74â†’- ORM: SQLAlchemy 75â†’- Task Queue: Celery 76â†’- Database: PostgreSQL 77â†’- Auth: JWT (python-jose) 78â†’ 79â†’**Key Directories:** 80â†’- `./backend/app` - Application code 81â†’- `./backend/app/api/v1` - API routes (contains ~58 routes) 82â†’- `./backend/app/models` - Data models 83â†’ 84â†’**Entry Point:** `./backend/app/main.py` 85â†’ 86â†’**How to Run:** 87â†’```bash 88â†’cd backend 89â†’pip install -r requirements.txt 90â†’uvicorn app.main:app --reload 91â†’``` 92â†’ 93â†’**Port:** 8000 94â†’ 95â†’## Files to Modify 96â†’ 97â†’| File | Service | What to Change | 98â†’|------|---------|---------------| 99â†’| `./frontend/src/App.tsx` | frontend | Import i18next configuration, configure language provider, apply RTL direction | 100â†’| `./frontend/src/main.tsx` or entry file | frontend | Initialize i18next before app render | 101â†’| `./frontend/src/components/**/*.tsx` | frontend | Replace hardcoded strings with i18n.t() calls | 102â†’| `./frontend/src/pages/**/*.tsx` | frontend | Replace hardcoded strings with i18n.t() calls | 103â†’| `./frontend/package.json` | frontend | Add i18next, react-i18next, i18next-browser-languagedetector dependencies | 104â†’| `./frontend/src/i18n/locales/en.json` | frontend | Create English translation file (baseline) | 105â†’| `./frontend/src/i18n/locales/he.json` | frontend | Create Hebrew translation file | 106â†’| `./frontend/src/i18n/config.ts` | frontend | NEW - Create i18next configuration file | 107â†’| `./frontend/src/theme.ts` or emotion config | frontend | Configure RTL direction support for Emotion theming | 108â†’| `./frontend/public/locales/en/translation.json` | frontend | OPTIONAL - Public locales structure (alternative approach) | 109â†’| `./frontend/public/locales/he/translation.json` | frontend | OPTIONAL - Hebrew translations in public folder | 110â†’| `./backend/app/config.py` or settings | backend | Add available languages configuration | 111â†’| `./backend/app/main.py` | backend | Add Accept-Language header handling middleware | 112â†’| `./backend/app/api/v1/auth.py` | backend | Add user language preference to user model/response | 113â†’| `./backend/app/utils/localization.py` | backend | NEW - Create backend localization utility | 114â†’| `./backend/locales/en.json` | backend | Create English API message translations | 115â†’| `./backend/locales/he.json` | backend | Create Hebrew API message translations | 116â†’ 117â†’## Files to Reference 118â†’ 119â†’These files show patterns to follow and demonstrate existing component structures: 120â†’ 121â†’| File | Pattern to Copy | 122â†’|------|----------------| 123â†’| `./frontend/src/components/**/*.tsx` | React component structure and useState/useContext patterns | 124â†’| `./frontend/src/pages/**/*.tsx` | Page-level component composition and layout patterns | 125â†’| `./backend/app/api/v1/*.py` | FastAPI route structure and response formatting | 126â†’| `./backend/app/models/*.py` | SQLAlchemy model patterns | 127â†’| `./package.json` | Dependency management and script patterns | 128â†’ 129â†’## Patterns to Follow 130â†’ 131â†’### Pattern 1: i18next Configuration & React Integration 132â†’ 133â†’From similar React i18n implementations: 134â†’ 135â†’```typescript 136â†’import i18n from 'i18next'; 137â†’import { initReactI18next } from 'react-i18next'; 138â†’import LanguageDetector from 'i18next-browser-languagedetector'; 139â†’import enTranslations from './locales/en.json'; 140â†’import heTranslations from './locales/he.json'; 141â†’ 142â†’i18n 143â†’ .use(LanguageDetector) 144â†’ .use(initReactI18next) 145â†’ .init({ 146â†’ resources: { 147â†’ en: { translation: enTranslations }, 148â†’ he: { translation: heTranslations } 149â†’ }, 150â†’ fallbackLng: 'en', 151â†’ interpolation: { 152â†’ escapeValue: false 153â†’ }, 154â†’ detection: { 155â†’ order: ['localStorage', 'navigator'], 156â†’ caches: ['localStorage'] 157â†’ } 158â†’ }); 159â†’ 160â†’export default i18n; 161â†’``` 162â†’ 163â†’**Key Points:** 164â†’- Use `i18next-browser-languagedetector` to auto-detect user's browser language 165â†’- Store language preference in localStorage for persistence 166â†’- Set fallback to English if locale not found 167â†’- Initialize before React app renders 168â†’ 169â†’### Pattern 2: Using i18n in React Components 170â†’ 171â†’From typical React component patterns with i18n: 172â†’ 173â†’```typescript 174â†’import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'; 175â†’ 176â†’function MyComponent() { 177â†’ const { t, i18n } = useTranslation(); 178â†’ 179â†’ return ( 180â†’
181â†’

{t('page.title')}

182â†’ 183â†’

{t('common.welcome', { name: 'User' })}

184â†’
185â†’ ); 186â†’} 187â†’``` 188â†’ 189â†’**Key Points:** 190â†’- Use `useTranslation()` hook in functional components 191â†’- Access `i18n` object to check current language or change language 192â†’- Use dot notation for nested translations (e.g., `page.title`) 193â†’- Support interpolation for dynamic values (e.g., `{ name: 'User' }`) 194â†’ 195â†’### Pattern 3: RTL (Right-to-Left) Support with Material-UI 196â†’ 197â†’From Material-UI RTL documentation: 198â†’ 199â†’```typescript 200â†’import { ThemeProvider, createTheme } from '@mui/material/styles'; 201â†’ 202â†’const theme = createTheme({ 203â†’ direction: i18n.language === 'he' ? 'rtl' : 'ltr', 204â†’ // ... other theme properties 205â†’}); 206â†’ 207â†’// In component: 208â†’ 209â†’ 210â†’ 211â†’``` 212â†’ 213â†’**Key Points:** 214â†’- Set `direction` property in Material-UI theme based on current language 215â†’- Material-UI components automatically mirror when `direction: 'rtl'` 216â†’- Must set document direction: `document.dir = 'rtl'` or `document.dir = 'ltr'` 217â†’- Margins and padding automatically reverse for RTL 218â†’ 219â†’### Pattern 4: Translation File Structure 220â†’ 221â†’JSON translation file structure: 222â†’ 223â†’```json 224â†’{ 225â†’ "common": { 226â†’ "welcome": "Welcome", 227â†’ "goodbye": "Goodbye", 228â†’ "submit": "Submit" 229â†’ }, 230â†’ "buttons": { 231â†’ "save": "Save", 232â†’ "cancel": "Cancel", 233â†’ "delete": "Delete" 234â†’ }, 235â†’ "pages": { 236â†’ "home": { 237â†’ "title": "Home Page", 238â†’ "description": "Welcome to our application" 239â†’ } 240â†’ }, 241â†’ "errors": { 242â†’ "notFound": "Page not found", 243â†’ "unauthorized": "Unauthorized access", 244â†’ "serverError": "Server error occ ... 1â†’import { useState } from 'react'
     2â†’import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
     3â†’import AppBar from '@mui/material/AppBar'
     4â†’import Toolbar from '@mui/material/Toolbar'
     5â†’import Typography from '@mui/material/Typography'
     6â†’import IconButton from '@mui/material/IconButton'
     7â†’import Badge from '@mui/material/Badge'

     9â†’import Menu from '@mui/material/Menu'

    17â†’import LogoutIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Logout'
    18â†’import type { User, Project } from '../../types'
    19â†’import ProjectSelector from './ProjectSelector'
    20â†’import { useToast } from '../common/ToastProvider'
    21â†’
    22â†’interface HeaderProps {
    23â†’  user: User

    25â†’  projects: Project[]
    26â†’  onProjectChange: (projectId: string) => void
    27â†’  onLogout: () => void
    28â†’}
    29â†’
    30â†’export default function Header({ user, currentProject, projects, onProjectChange, onLogout }: HeaderProps) {
    31â†’  const { t } = useTranslation()
    32â†’  const { showInfo } = useToast()
    33â†’  const [anchorEl, setAnchorEl] = useState<null | HTMLElement>(null)
    34â†’  const [notificationAnchor, setNotificationAnchor] = useState<null | HTMLElement>(null)
    35â†’
    36â†’  const handleMenuOpen = (event: React.MouseEvent<HTMLElement>) => {
    37â†’    setAnchorEl(event.currentTarget)
    38â†’  }
    39â†’
    40â†’  const handleMenuClose = () => {
    41â†’    setAnchorEl(null)
    42â†’  }
    43â†’
    44â†’  const handleNotificationOpen = (event: React.MouseEvent<HTMLElement>) => {
    45â†’    setNotificationAnchor(event.currentTarget)
    46â†’  }
    47â†’
    48â†’  const handleNotificationClose = () => {
    49â†’    setNotificationAnchor(null)
    50â†’  }
    51â†’
    52â†’  const getInitials = (name: string) => {
    53â†’    return name.split(' ').map(n => n[0]).join('').toUpperCase().slice(0, 2)
    54â†’  }
    55â†’
    56â†’  return (
    57â†’    <AppBar
    58â†’      position="fixed"
    59â†’      color="inherit"
    60â†’      elevation={0}
    61â†’      sx={{
    62â†’        zIndex: (theme) => theme.zIndex.drawer + 1,
    63â†’        borderBottom: '1px solid',
    64â†’        borderColor: 'divider',
    65â†’        bgcolor: 'background.paper',
    66â†’        ml: '260px',
    67â†’        width: 'calc(100% - 260px)',
    68â†’      }}
    69â†’    >
    70â†’      <Toolbar sx={{ justifyContent: 'space-between' }}>
    71â†’        <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: 2 }}>
    72â†’          <ProjectSelector
    73â†’            projects={projects}
    74â†’            currentProject={currentProject}
    75â†’            onProjectChange={onProjectChange}
    76â†’          />
    77â†’        </Box>
    78â†’
    79â†’        <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: 1 }}>
    80â†’          <IconButton onClick={handleNotificationOpen}>
    81â†’            <Badge badgeContent={3} color="error">
    82â†’              <NotificationsIcon />
    83â†’            </Badge>
    84â†’          </IconButton>
    85â†’
    86â†’          <IconButton onClick={handleMenuOpen} sx={{ ml: 1 }}>
    87â†’            <Avatar sx={{ width: 36, height: 36, bgcolor: 'primary.main' }}>
    88â†’              {getInitials(user.fullName || user.email)}
    89â†’            </Avatar>
    90â†’          </IconButton>
    91â†’        </Box>
    92â†’
    93â†’        <Menu
    94â†’          anchorEl={notificationAnchor}
    95â†’          open={Boolean(notificationAnchor)}
    96â†’          onClose={handleNotificationClose}
    97â†’          PaperProps={{ sx: { width: 320, maxHeight: 400 } }}
    98â†’        >
    99â†’          <Box sx={{ px: 2, py: 1 }}>
   100â†’            <Typography variant="subtitle1" fontWeight="bold">{t('header.notifications')}</Typography>
   101â†’          </Box>
   102â†’          <Divider />
   103â†’          <MenuItem onClick={handleNotificationClose}>
   104â†’            <Box>
   105â†’              <Typography variant="body2">{t('header.notifications_equipment_pending')}</Typography>
   106â†’              <Typography variant="caption" color="text.secondary">{t('header.notifications_equipment_detail', { name: 'Concrete Pump CP-200' })}</Typography>
   107â†’            </Box>
   108â†’          </MenuItem>
   109â†’          <MenuItem onClick={handleNotificationClose}>
   110â†’            <Box>
   111â†’              <Typography variant="body2">{t('header.notifications_meeting_scheduled')}</Typography>
   112â†’              <Typography variant="caption" color="text.secondary">{t('header.notifications_meeting_detail', { name: 'Weekly Site Coordination', date: 'Tomorrow', time: '9:00 AM' })}</Typography>
   113â†’            </Box>
   114â†’          </MenuItem>
   115â†’          <MenuItem onClick={handleNotificationClose}>
   116â†’            <Box>
   117â†’              <Typography variant="body2">{t('header.notifications_material_delivery')}</Typography>
   118â†’              <Typography variant="caption" color="text.secondary">{t('header.notifications_material_detail', { material: 'Reinforcement Steel', quantity: '150 tons' })}</Typography>
   119â†’            </Box>
   120â†’          </MenuItem>
   121â†’          <Divider />
   122â†’          <MenuItem sx={{ justifyContent: 'center' }}>
   123â†’            <Typography variant="body2" color="primary">{t('header.viewAllNotifications')}</Typography>
   124â†’          </MenuItem>
   125â†’        </Menu>
   126â†’
   127â†’        <Menu
   128â†’          anchorEl={anchorEl}
   129â†’          open={Boolean(anchorEl)}
   130â†’          onClose={handleMenuClose}
   131â†’          PaperProps={{ sx: { width: 200 } }}
   132â†’        >
   133â†’          <Box sx={{ px: 2, py: 1 }}>
   134â†’            <Typography variant="subtitle2">{user.fullName}</Typography>
   135â†’            <Typography variant="caption" color="text.secondary">{user.email}</Typography>
   136â†’          </Box>
   137â†’          <Divider />
   138â†’          <MenuItem onClick={() => { handleMenuClose(); showInfo(t('header.profileComingSoon')); }}>
   139â†’            <ListItemIcon><PersonIcon fontSize="small" /></ListItemIcon>
   140â†’            {t('header.profile')}
   141â†’          </MenuItem>
   142â†’          <MenuItem onClick={() => { handleMenuClose(); showInfo(t('header.settingsComingSoon')); }}>
   143â†’            <ListItemIcon><SettingsIcon fontSize="small" /></ListItemIcon>
   144â†’            {t('header.settings')}
   145â†’          </MenuItem>
   146â†’          <Divider />
   147â†’          <MenuItem onClick={onLogout}>
   148â†’            <ListItemIcon><LogoutIcon fontSize="small" /></ListItemIcon>
   149â†’            {t('header.logout')}
   150â†’          </MenuItem>
   151â†’        </Menu>
   152â†’      </Toolbar>
   153â†’    </AppBar>
   154â†’  )
   155â†’}
   156â†’

## Component Features
1. Icon Button with Language Icon - displays language selector
2. Dropdown Menu - shows English and Hebrew options
3. Selected State - indicates current language selection
4. i18n Integration - uses i18n.changeLanguage() to switch language
5. Translation Keys - all labels translated via t() function

## How It Works
1. User clicks Language Icon in header
2. Dropdown menu appears with two options:
   - English (×× ×’×œ×™×ª when in Hebrew mode)
   - Hebrew (×¢×‘×¨×™×ª)
3. Clicking an option:
   - Calls i18n.changeLanguage(lng)
   - Closes the menu
   - Entire UI updates immediately to selected language
   - Language preference is persisted in localStorage (handled by i18next)

## Testing Instructions
1. Start the frontend dev server: cd frontend && npm run dev
2. Navigate to http://localhost:3000

4. Click the icon to open language selection menu
5. Select "Hebrew" (×¢×‘×¨×™×ª) - entire UI should switch to Hebrew RTL layout
6. Select "English" - UI should switch back to English LTR layout
7. Verify all text updates immediately
8. Reload page - language preference should persist

1â†’# Specification: Translate Product to Hebrew 2â†’ 3â†’## Overview 4â†’ 5â†’This task involves implementing comprehensive Hebrew language support for the entire product, including the React frontend UI, backend API responses, and error messages. The implementation will establish a full internationalization (i18n) infrastructure using industry-standard tools, enabling the application to serve Hebrew-speaking users with proper right-to-left (RTL) layout support. This is a foundational feature that enables language localization and sets up the architecture for future language additions. 6â†’ 7â†’## Workflow Type 8â†’ 9â†’**Type**: feature 10â†’ 11â†’**Rationale**: This is a new feature implementation that adds internationalization infrastructure and Hebrew language support to the product. It requires changes across multiple services (frontend and backend), introduces new dependencies, modifies component rendering, and establishes patterns for future localization work. 12â†’ 13â†’## Task Scope 14â†’ 15â†’### Services Involved 16â†’- **frontend** (primary) - React application with all UI components, dialogs, forms, and user-facing text 17â†’- **backend** (secondary) - FastAPI application for translating API error messages and response content 18â†’ 19â†’### This Task Will: 20â†’- [ ] Install and configure i18next internationalization framework in frontend 21â†’- [ ] Create Hebrew translation files for all UI strings, labels, buttons, placeholders 22â†’- [ ] Extract all hardcoded English strings from React components 23â†’- [ ] Implement RTL (right-to-left) support for Hebrew layout 24â†’- [ ] Configure language switching mechanism in the application 25â†’- [ ] Create backend translation endpoints or response localization layer 26â†’- [ ] Add Hebrew language option to user preferences/settings 27â†’- [ ] Verify all Material-UI components respect RTL direction 28â†’- [ ] Test date, time, number, and currency formatting for Hebrew locale 29â†’ 30â†’### Out of Scope: 31â†’- Translation of documentation or internal README files 32â†’- Marketing website content (if separate from product) 33â†’- Mobile app support (unless part of this product) 34â†’- Other language support beyond Hebrew (future feature) 35â†’- Profiling or optimization of i18n performance 36â†’- Cloud-based translation management tools (Crowdin, Lokalise) - using local JSON files 37â†’- Voice/audio content translation 38â†’ 39â†’## Service Context 40â†’ 41â†’### Frontend Service 42â†’ 43â†’**Tech Stack:** 44â†’- Language: TypeScript 45â†’- Framework: React 46â†’- Build Tool: Vite 47â†’- CSS-in-JS: Emotion 48â†’- UI Library: Material-UI (@mui/material) 49â†’- HTTP Client: axios 50â†’- Router: react-router-dom 51â†’ 52â†’**Key Directories:** 53â†’- `./frontend/src` - Main source code 54â†’- `./frontend/src/components` - React components (primary target for extraction) 55â†’- `./frontend/src/pages` - Page components 56â†’- `./frontend/src/App.tsx` - Main app component (entry point) 57â†’ 58â†’**Entry Point:** `./frontend/src/App.tsx` 59â†’ 60â†’**How to Run:** 61â†’```bash 62â†’cd frontend 63â†’npm install 64â†’npm run dev 65â†’``` 66â†’ 67â†’**Port:** 3000 68â†’ 69â†’### Backend Service 70â†’ 71â†’**Tech Stack:** 72â†’- Language: Python 73â†’- Framework: FastAPI 74â†’- ORM: SQLAlchemy 75â†’- Task Queue: Celery 76â†’- Database: PostgreSQL 77â†’- Auth: JWT (python-jose) 78â†’ 79â†’**Key Directories:** 80â†’- `./backend/app` - Application code 81â†’- `./backend/app/api/v1` - API routes (contains ~58 routes) 82â†’- `./backend/app/models` - Data models 83â†’ 84â†’**Entry Point:** `./backend/app/main.py` 85â†’ 86â†’**How to Run:** 87â†’```bash 88â†’cd backend 89â†’pip install -r requirements.txt 90â†’uvicorn app.main:app --reload 91â†’``` 92â†’ 93â†’**Port:** 8000 94â†’ 95â†’## Files to Modify 96â†’ 97â†’| File | Service | What to Change | 98â†’|------|---------|---------------| 99â†’| `./frontend/src/App.tsx` | frontend | Import i18next configuration, configure language provider, apply RTL direction | 100â†’| `./frontend/src/main.tsx` or entry file | frontend | Initialize i18next before app render | 101â†’| `./frontend/src/components/**/*.tsx` | frontend | Replace hardcoded strings with i18n.t() calls | 102â†’| `./frontend/src/pages/**/*.tsx` | frontend | Replace hardcoded strings with i18n.t() calls | 103â†’| `./frontend/package.json` | frontend | Add i18next, react-i18next, i18next-browser-languagedetector dependencies | 104â†’| `./frontend/src/i18n/locales/en.json` | frontend | Create English translation file (baseline) | 105â†’| `./frontend/src/i18n/locales/he.json` | frontend | Create Hebrew translation file | 106â†’| `./frontend/src/i18n/config.ts` | frontend | NEW - Create i18next configuration file | 107â†’| `./frontend/src/theme.ts` or emotion config | frontend | Configure RTL direction support for Emotion theming | 108â†’| `./frontend/public/locales/en/translation.json` | frontend | OPTIONAL - Public locales structure (alternative approach) | 109â†’| `./frontend/public/locales/he/translation.json` | frontend | OPTIONAL - Hebrew translations in public folder | 110â†’| `./backend/app/config.py` or settings | backend | Add available languages configuration | 111â†’| `./backend/app/main.py` | backend | Add Accept-Language header handling middleware | 112â†’| `./backend/app/api/v1/auth.py` | backend | Add user language preference to user model/response | 113â†’| `./backend/app/utils/localization.py` | backend | NEW - Create backend localization utility | 114â†’| `./backend/locales/en.json` | backend | Create English API message translations | 115â†’| `./backend/locales/he.json` | backend | Create Hebrew API message translations | 116â†’ 117â†’## Files to Reference 118â†’ 119â†’These files show patterns to follow and demonstrate existing component structures: 120â†’ 121â†’| File | Pattern to Copy | 122â†’|------|----------------| 123â†’| `./frontend/src/components/**/*.tsx` | React component structure and useState/useContext patterns | 124â†’| `./frontend/src/pages/**/*.tsx` | Page-level component composition and layout patterns | 125â†’| `./backend/app/api/v1/*.py` | FastAPI route structure and response formatting | 126â†’| `./backend/app/models/*.py` | SQLAlchemy model patterns | 127â†’| `./package.json` | Dependency management and script patterns | 128â†’ 129â†’## Patterns to Follow 130â†’ 131â†’### Pattern 1: i18next Configuration & React Integration 132â†’ 133â†’From similar React i18n implementations: 134â†’ 135â†’```typescript 136â†’import i18n from 'i18next'; 137â†’import { initReactI18next } from 'react-i18next'; 138â†’import LanguageDetector from 'i18next-browser-languagedetector'; 139â†’import enTranslations from './locales/en.json'; 140â†’import heTranslations from './locales/he.json'; 141â†’ 142â†’i18n 143â†’ .use(LanguageDetector) 144â†’ .use(initReactI18next) 145â†’ .init({ 146â†’ resources: { 147â†’ en: { translation: enTranslations }, 148â†’ he: { translation: heTranslations } 149â†’ }, 150â†’ fallbackLng: 'en', 151â†’ interpolation: { 152â†’ escapeValue: false 153â†’ }, 154â†’ detection: { 155â†’ order: ['localStorage', 'navigator'], 156â†’ caches: ['localStorage'] 157â†’ } 158â†’ }); 159â†’ 160â†’export default i18n; 161â†’``` 162â†’ 163â†’**Key Points:** 164â†’- Use `i18next-browser-languagedetector` to auto-detect user's browser language 165â†’- Store language preference in localStorage for persistence 166â†’- Set fallback to English if locale not found 167â†’- Initialize before React app renders 168â†’ 169â†’### Pattern 2: Using i18n in React Components 170â†’ 171â†’From typical React component patterns with i18n: 172â†’ 173â†’```typescript 174â†’import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'; 175â†’ 176â†’function MyComponent() { 177â†’ const { t, i18n } = useTranslation(); 178â†’ 179â†’ return ( 180â†’
181â†’

{t('page.title')}

182â†’ 183â†’

{t('common.welcome', { name: 'User' })}

184â†’
185â†’ ); 186â†’} 187â†’``` 188â†’ 189â†’**Key Points:** 190â†’- Use `useTranslation()` hook in functional components 191â†’- Access `i18n` object to check current language or change language 192â†’- Use dot notation for nested translations (e.g., `page.title`) 193â†’- Support interpolation for dynamic values (e.g., `{ name: 'User' }`) 194â†’ 195â†’### Pattern 3: RTL (Right-to-Left) Support with Material-UI 196â†’ 197â†’From Material-UI RTL documentation: 198â†’ 199â†’```typescript 200â†’import { ThemeProvider, createTheme } from '@mui/material/styles'; 201â†’ 202â†’const theme = createTheme({ 203â†’ direction: i18n.language === 'he' ? 'rtl' : 'ltr', 204â†’ // ... other theme properties 205â†’}); 206â†’ 207â†’// In component: 208â†’ 209â†’ 210â†’ 211â†’``` 212â†’ 213â†’**Key Points:** 214â†’- Set `direction` property in Material-UI theme based on current language 215â†’- Material-UI components automatically mirror when `direction: 'rtl'` 216â†’- Must set document direction: `document.dir = 'rtl'` or `document.dir = 'ltr'` 217â†’- Margins and padding automatically reverse for RTL 218â†’ 219â†’### Pattern 4: Translation File Structure 220â†’ 221â†’JSON translation file structure: 222â†’ 223â†’```json 224â†’{ 225â†’ "common": { 226â†’ "welcome": "Welcome", 227â†’ "goodbye": "Goodbye", 228â†’ "submit": "Submit" 229â†’ }, 230â†’ "buttons": { 231â†’ "save": "Save", 232â†’ "cancel": "Cancel", 233â†’ "delete": "Delete" 234â†’ }, 235â†’ "pages": { 236â†’ "home": { 237â†’ "title": "Home Page", 238â†’ "description": "Welcome to our application" 239â†’ } 240â†’ }, 241â†’ "errors": { 242â†’ "notFound": "Page not found", 243â†’ "unauthorized": "Unauthorized access", 244â†’ "serverError": "Server error occ ... 1â†’from datetime import datetime, timedelta
     2â†’from uuid import UUID
     3â†’from fastapi import Depends, HTTPException, status
     4â†’from fastapi.security import HTTPBearer, HTTPAuthorizationCredentials
     5â†’from sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio import AsyncSession
     6â†’from sqlalchemy import select
     7â†’from jose import JWTError, jwt
     8â†’from passlib.context import CryptContext
     9â†’from app.db.session import get_db
    10â†’from app.models.user import User
    11â†’from app.config import get_settings
    12â†’
    13â†’security = HTTPBearer(auto_error=False)
    14â†’pwd_context = CryptContext(schemes=["bcrypt"], deprecated="auto")
    15â†’
    16â†’settings = get_settings()
    17â†’SECRET_KEY = settings.secret_key
    18â†’ALGORITHM = "HS256"
    19â†’ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_DAYS = 7
    20â†’
    21â†’
    22â†’def verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) -> bool:
    23â†’    return pwd_context.verify(plain_password, hashed_password)
    24â†’
    25â†’
    26â†’def get_password_hash(password: str) -> str:
    27â†’    return pwd_context.hash(password)
    28â†’
    29â†’
    30â†’def create_access_token(user_id: UUID) -> str:
    31â†’    expire = datetime.utcnow() + timedelta(days=ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_DAYS)
    32â†’    to_encode = {"sub": str(user_id), "exp": expire}
    33â†’    return jwt.encode(to_encode, SECRET_KEY, algorithm=ALGORITHM)
    34â†’
    35â†’
    36â†’def decode_access_token(token: str) -> UUID | None:
    37â†’    try:
    38â†’        payload = jwt.decode(token, SECRET_KEY, algorithms=[ALGORITHM])
    39â†’        user_id = payload.get("sub")
    40â†’        if user_id is None:
    41â†’            return None
    42â†’        return UUID(user_id)
    43â†’    except JWTError:
    44â†’        return None
    45â†’
    46â†’
    47â†’async def get_current_user(
    48â†’    credentials: Optional[HTTPAuthorizationCredentials] = Depends(security),
    49â†’    db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)
    50â†’) -> User:
    51â†’    if credentials is None:
    52â†’        raise HTTPException(
    53â†’            status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
    54â†’            detail="Not authenticated"
    55â†’        )
    56â†’
    57â†’    user_id = decode_access_token(credentials.credentials)
    58â†’    if user_id is None:
    59â†’        raise HTTPException(
    60â†’            status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
    61â†’            detail="Invalid or expired token"
    62â†’        )
    63â†’
    64â†’    result = await db.execute(select(User).where(User.id == user_id))
    65â†’    user = result.scalar_one_or_none()
    66â†’
    67â†’    if not user:
    68â†’        raise HTTPException(
    69â†’            status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
    70â†’            detail="User not found"
    71â†’        )
    72â†’
    73â†’    if not user.is_active:
    74â†’        raise HTTPException(
    75â†’            status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
    76â†’            detail="User is inactive"
    77â†’        )
    78â†’
    79â†’    return user
    80â†’
    81â†’
    82â†’async def get_current_user_optional(
    83â†’    credentials: Optional[HTTPAuthorizationCredentials] = Depends(security),
    84â†’    db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)
    85â†’) -> Optional[User]:

1â†’"""
     2â†’Localization utilities for translating API messages based on Accept-Language header.
     3â†’
     4â†’This module provides functions to:
     5â†’- Extract language preference from request headers
     6â†’- Translate error messages and API responses
     7â†’- Support multiple languages (currently English and Hebrew)
     8â†’"""
     9â†’
    10â†’from typing import Dict, Optional
    11â†’from fastapi import Request
    12â†’
    13â†’

    54â†’SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES = ['en', 'he']
    55â†’DEFAULT_LANGUAGE = 'en'
    56â†’
    57â†’
    58â†’def parse_accept_language_header(accept_language: str) -> str:
    59â†’    """
    60â†’    Parse Accept-Language header to extract the primary language code.
    61â†’
    62â†’    Args:
    63â†’        accept_language: The Accept-Language header value (e.g., 'he-IL,he;q=0.9,en;q=0.8')
    64â†’
    65â†’    Returns:
    66â†’        Language code (e.g., 'he', 'en'). Returns 'en' if unable to parse.
    67â†’    """
    68â†’    if not accept_language:
    69â†’        return DEFAULT_LANGUAGE
    70â†’
    71â†’    # Split by comma to get language preferences
    72â†’    languages = accept_language.split(',')
    73â†’    for lang_pref in languages:
    74â†’        # Split by semicolon to separate language from quality factor
    75â†’        lang_code = lang_pref.split(';')[0].strip()
    76â†’        # Get the primary language code (before '-' in cases like 'he-IL')
    77â†’        primary_lang = lang_code.split('-')[0].lower()
    78â†’        # Return the first supported language found
    79â†’        if primary_lang in SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES:
    80â†’            return primary_lang
    81â†’
    82â†’    return DEFAULT_LANGUAGE
    83â†’
    84â†’
    85â†’def get_language_from_request(request: Request) -> str:
    86â†’    """
    87â†’    Extract the user's preferred language from the request.
    88â†’
    89â†’    First checks the Accept-Language header, then falls back to default language.
    90â†’
    91â†’    Args:
    92â†’        request: FastAPI Request object
    93â†’
    94â†’    Returns:
    95â†’        Language code ('en' or 'he')
    96â†’    """
    97â†’    accept_language = request.headers.get('Accept-Language', DEFAULT_LANGUAGE)
    98â†’    return parse_accept_language_header(accept_language)

   101â†’def translate_message(message_key: str, language: str, messages: Optional[Dict[str, Dict[str, str]]] = None) -> str:
   102â†’    """
   103â†’    Translate a message key to the specified language.
   104â†’
   105â†’    Falls back to English if the key is not found in the specified language.
   106â†’    If the language is not supported, uses English as fallback.
   107â†’
   108â†’    Args:
   109â†’        message_key: The translation key (e.g., 'email_already_registered')
   110â†’        language: Language code ('en' or 'he')
   111â†’        messages: Optional custom messages dictionary. Uses DEFAULT_MESSAGES if not provided.
   112â†’
   113â†’    Returns:
   114â†’        Translated message string, or the key itself if translation not found
   115â†’    """
   116â†’    if messages is None:
   117â†’        messages = DEFAULT_MESSAGES
   118â†’
   119â†’    # Normalize language to supported languages
   120â†’    if language not in SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES:
   121â†’        language = DEFAULT_LANGUAGE
   122â†’
   123â†’    # Try to get translation in requested language
   124â†’    if language in messages and message_key in messages[language]:
   125â†’        return messages[language][message_key]
   126â†’
   127â†’    # Fallback to English if key not found in requested language
   128â†’    if message_key in messages[DEFAULT_LANGUAGE]:
   129â†’        return messages[DEFAULT_LANGUAGE][message_key]
   130â†’
   131â†’    # Return the key itself if no translation found
   132â†’    return message_key
   133â†’
   134â†’
   135â†’def get_error_message(message_key: str, request: Request, messages: Optional[Dict[str, Dict[str, str]]] = None) -> str:
   136â†’    """
   137â†’    Get an error message translated to the user's preferred language from request.
   138â†’
   139â†’    Convenience function that combines language detection and translation.
   140â†’
   141â†’    Args:
   142â†’        message_key: The translation key for the error message
   143â†’        request: FastAPI Request object
   144â†’        messages: Optional custom messages dictionary
   145â†’
   146â†’    Returns:
   147â†’        Translated error message
   148â†’    """
   149â†’    language = get_language_from_request(request)

   151â†’
   152â†’
   153â†’def is_language_supported(language: str) -> bool:
   154â†’    """

entries.content:
## âœ… Subtask-3-1 Complete: Backend Localization Utility Module

I have successfully completed **subtask-3-1** - "Create backend localization utility module with message translation functions". Here's what was accomplished:

### ğŸ“ Files Created:
1. **`backend/app/utils/__init__.py`** - Package initialization file
2. **`backend/app/utils/localization.py`** - Main localization module (5.7 KB)

### ğŸ¯ Core Functions Implemented:

1. **`parse_accept_language_header()`** - Parses the Accept-Language HTTP header
   - Handles complex header formats (e.g., `he-IL,he;q=0.9,en;q=0.8`)
   - Extracts the primary language code
   - Falls back to English if no supported language is found

2. **`get_language_from_request()`** - Extracts language from FastAPI Request object
   - Retrieves Accept-Language header
   - Returns language code ('en' or 'he')

3. **`translate_message()`** - Core translation function
   - Translates message keys to specified language
   - Gracefully falls back to English if key not found
   - Supports custom message dictionaries

4. **`get_error_message()`** - Convenience function for error responses
   - Combines language detection and translation
   - Perfect for API endpoints to return localized errors

5. **`is_language_supported()`** - Validates language support
   - Case-insensitive language checking
   - Returns True for supported languages ('en', 'he')

### ğŸ“ Default Messages Included:
The module includes English and Hebrew translations for 15 common API error messages:
- `email_already_registered`
- `invalid_credentials`
- `account_inactive`
- `not_authenticated`
- And 10 more common error scenarios...

### âœ¨ Code Quality Highlights:
âœ… Follows backend patterns from `app/core/security.py`
âœ… Proper Python 3.10+ type hints
âœ… Comprehensive docstrings for all functions
âœ… Hebrew Unicode characters properly encoded
âœ… No debug statements or console logging
âœ… Proper error handling with fallback mechanisms
âœ… Python syntax validated successfully

### ğŸ“¦ Git Commit:
```
Hash: 725da53
Message: auto-claude: subtask-3-1 - Create backend localization utility module with message translation functions
```

### âœ… Verification Status:
- File exists: âœ“ OK
- Python syntax: âœ“ Valid
- File size: 5.7 KB
- Git committed: âœ“ Successfully

The implementation plan has been updated to mark **subtask-3-1** as **completed** with detailed notes.

### ğŸš€ Next Steps:
The next subtask (**subtask-3-2**) will involve creating JSON translation files (`app/locales/en.json` and `app/locales/he.json`) that this module can load and use for more flexible, file-based translations.
I'll start by checking my current directory and understanding the task structure.

1â†’# Specification: Translate Product to Hebrew 2â†’ 3â†’## Overview 4â†’ 5â†’This task involves implementing comprehensive Hebrew language support for the entire product, including the React frontend UI, backend API responses, and error messages. The implementation will establish a full internationalization (i18n) infrastructure using industry-standard tools, enabling the application to serve Hebrew-speaking users with proper right-to-left (RTL) layout support. This is a foundational feature that enables language localization and sets up the architecture for future language additions. 6â†’ 7â†’## Workflow Type 8â†’ 9â†’**Type**: feature 10â†’ 11â†’**Rationale**: This is a new feature implementation that adds internationalization infrastructure and Hebrew language support to the product. It requires changes across multiple services (frontend and backend), introduces new dependencies, modifies component rendering, and establishes patterns for future localization work. 12â†’ 13â†’## Task Scope 14â†’ 15â†’### Services Involved 16â†’- **frontend** (primary) - React application with all UI components, dialogs, forms, and user-facing text 17â†’- **backend** (secondary) - FastAPI application for translating API error messages and response content 18â†’ 19â†’### This Task Will: 20â†’- [ ] Install and configure i18next internationalization framework in frontend 21â†’- [ ] Create Hebrew translation files for all UI strings, labels, buttons, placeholders 22â†’- [ ] Extract all hardcoded English strings from React components 23â†’- [ ] Implement RTL (right-to-left) support for Hebrew layout 24â†’- [ ] Configure language switching mechanism in the application 25â†’- [ ] Create backend translation endpoints or response localization layer 26â†’- [ ] Add Hebrew language option to user preferences/settings 27â†’- [ ] Verify all Material-UI components respect RTL direction 28â†’- [ ] Test date, time, number, and currency formatting for Hebrew locale 29â†’ 30â†’### Out of Scope: 31â†’- Translation of documentation or internal README files 32â†’- Marketing website content (if separate from product) 33â†’- Mobile app support (unless part of this product) 34â†’- Other language support beyond Hebrew (future feature) 35â†’- Profiling or optimization of i18n performance 36â†’- Cloud-based translation management tools (Crowdin, Lokalise) - using local JSON files 37â†’- Voice/audio content translation 38â†’ 39â†’## Service Context 40â†’ 41â†’### Frontend Service 42â†’ 43â†’**Tech Stack:** 44â†’- Language: TypeScript 45â†’- Framework: React 46â†’- Build Tool: Vite 47â†’- CSS-in-JS: Emotion 48â†’- UI Library: Material-UI (@mui/material) 49â†’- HTTP Client: axios 50â†’- Router: react-router-dom 51â†’ 52â†’**Key Directories:** 53â†’- `./frontend/src` - Main source code 54â†’- `./frontend/src/components` - React components (primary target for extraction) 55â†’- `./frontend/src/pages` - Page components 56â†’- `./frontend/src/App.tsx` - Main app component (entry point) 57â†’ 58â†’**Entry Point:** `./frontend/src/App.tsx` 59â†’ 60â†’**How to Run:** 61â†’```bash 62â†’cd frontend 63â†’npm install 64â†’npm run dev 65â†’``` 66â†’ 67â†’**Port:** 3000 68â†’ 69â†’### Backend Service 70â†’ 71â†’**Tech Stack:** 72â†’- Language: Python 73â†’- Framework: FastAPI 74â†’- ORM: SQLAlchemy 75â†’- Task Queue: Celery 76â†’- Database: PostgreSQL 77â†’- Auth: JWT (python-jose) 78â†’ 79â†’**Key Directories:** 80â†’- `./backend/app` - Application code 81â†’- `./backend/app/api/v1` - API routes (contains ~58 routes) 82â†’- `./backend/app/models` - Data models 83â†’ 84â†’**Entry Point:** `./backend/app/main.py` 85â†’ 86â†’**How to Run:** 87â†’```bash 88â†’cd backend 89â†’pip install -r requirements.txt 90â†’uvicorn app.main:app --reload 91â†’``` 92â†’ 93â†’**Port:** 8000 94â†’ 95â†’## Files to Modify 96â†’ 97â†’| File | Service | What to Change | 98â†’|------|---------|---------------| 99â†’| `./frontend/src/App.tsx` | frontend | Import i18next configuration, configure language provider, apply RTL direction | 100â†’| `./frontend/src/main.tsx` or entry file | frontend | Initialize i18next before app render | 101â†’| `./frontend/src/components/**/*.tsx` | frontend | Replace hardcoded strings with i18n.t() calls | 102â†’| `./frontend/src/pages/**/*.tsx` | frontend | Replace hardcoded strings with i18n.t() calls | 103â†’| `./frontend/package.json` | frontend | Add i18next, react-i18next, i18next-browser-languagedetector dependencies | 104â†’| `./frontend/src/i18n/locales/en.json` | frontend | Create English translation file (baseline) | 105â†’| `./frontend/src/i18n/locales/he.json` | frontend | Create Hebrew translation file | 106â†’| `./frontend/src/i18n/config.ts` | frontend | NEW - Create i18next configuration file | 107â†’| `./frontend/src/theme.ts` or emotion config | frontend | Configure RTL direction support for Emotion theming | 108â†’| `./frontend/public/locales/en/translation.json` | frontend | OPTIONAL - Public locales structure (alternative approach) | 109â†’| `./frontend/public/locales/he/translation.json` | frontend | OPTIONAL - Hebrew translations in public folder | 110â†’| `./backend/app/config.py` or settings | backend | Add available languages configuration | 111â†’| `./backend/app/main.py` | backend | Add Accept-Language header handling middleware | 112â†’| `./backend/app/api/v1/auth.py` | backend | Add user language preference to user model/response | 113â†’| `./backend/app/utils/localization.py` | backend | NEW - Create backend localization utility | 114â†’| `./backend/locales/en.json` | backend | Create English API message translations | 115â†’| `./backend/locales/he.json` | backend | Create Hebrew API message translations | 116â†’ 117â†’## Files to Reference 118â†’ 119â†’These files show patterns to follow and demonstrate existing component structures: 120â†’ 121â†’| File | Pattern to Copy | 122â†’|------|----------------| 123â†’| `./frontend/src/components/**/*.tsx` | React component structure and useState/useContext patterns | 124â†’| `./frontend/src/pages/**/*.tsx` | Page-level component composition and layout patterns | 125â†’| `./backend/app/api/v1/*.py` | FastAPI route structure and response formatting | 126â†’| `./backend/app/models/*.py` | SQLAlchemy model patterns | 127â†’| `./package.json` | Dependency management and script patterns | 128â†’ 129â†’## Patterns to Follow 130â†’ 131â†’### Pattern 1: i18next Configuration & React Integration 132â†’ 133â†’From similar React i18n implementations: 134â†’ 135â†’```typescript 136â†’import i18n from 'i18next'; 137â†’import { initReactI18next } from 'react-i18next'; 138â†’import LanguageDetector from 'i18next-browser-languagedetector'; 139â†’import enTranslations from './locales/en.json'; 140â†’import heTranslations from './locales/he.json'; 141â†’ 142â†’i18n 143â†’ .use(LanguageDetector) 144â†’ .use(initReactI18next) 145â†’ .init({ 146â†’ resources: { 147â†’ en: { translation: enTranslations }, 148â†’ he: { translation: heTranslations } 149â†’ }, 150â†’ fallbackLng: 'en', 151â†’ interpolation: { 152â†’ escapeValue: false 153â†’ }, 154â†’ detection: { 155â†’ order: ['localStorage', 'navigator'], 156â†’ caches: ['localStorage'] 157â†’ } 158â†’ }); 159â†’ 160â†’export default i18n; 161â†’``` 162â†’ 163â†’**Key Points:** 164â†’- Use `i18next-browser-languagedetector` to auto-detect user's browser language 165â†’- Store language preference in localStorage for persistence 166â†’- Set fallback to English if locale not found 167â†’- Initialize before React app renders 168â†’ 169â†’### Pattern 2: Using i18n in React Components 170â†’ 171â†’From typical React component patterns with i18n: 172â†’ 173â†’```typescript 174â†’import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'; 175â†’ 176â†’function MyComponent() { 177â†’ const { t, i18n } = useTranslation(); 178â†’ 179â†’ return ( 180â†’
181â†’

{t('page.title')}

182â†’ 183â†’

{t('common.welcome', { name: 'User' })}

184â†’
185â†’ ); 186â†’} 187â†’``` 188â†’ 189â†’**Key Points:** 190â†’- Use `useTranslation()` hook in functional components 191â†’- Access `i18n` object to check current language or change language 192â†’- Use dot notation for nested translations (e.g., `page.title`) 193â†’- Support interpolation for dynamic values (e.g., `{ name: 'User' }`) 194â†’ 195â†’### Pattern 3: RTL (Right-to-Left) Support with Material-UI 196â†’ 197â†’From Material-UI RTL documentation: 198â†’ 199â†’```typescript 200â†’import { ThemeProvider, createTheme } from '@mui/material/styles'; 201â†’ 202â†’const theme = createTheme({ 203â†’ direction: i18n.language === 'he' ? 'rtl' : 'ltr', 204â†’ // ... other theme properties 205â†’}); 206â†’ 207â†’// In component: 208â†’ 209â†’ 210â†’ 211â†’``` 212â†’ 213â†’**Key Points:** 214â†’- Set `direction` property in Material-UI theme based on current language 215â†’- Material-UI components automatically mirror when `direction: 'rtl'` 216â†’- Must set document direction: `document.dir = 'rtl'` or `document.dir = 'ltr'` 217â†’- Margins and padding automatically reverse for RTL 218â†’ 219â†’### Pattern 4: Translation File Structure 220â†’ 221â†’JSON translation file structure: 222â†’ 223â†’```json 224â†’{ 225â†’ "common": { 226â†’ "welcome": "Welcome", 227â†’ "goodbye": "Goodbye", 228â†’ "submit": "Submit" 229â†’ }, 230â†’ "buttons": { 231â†’ "save": "Save", 232â†’ "cancel": "Cancel", 233â†’ "delete": "Delete" 234â†’ }, 235â†’ "pages": { 236â†’ "home": { 237â†’ "title": "Home Page", 238â†’ "description": "Welcome to our application" 239â†’ } 240â†’ }, 241â†’ "errors": { 242â†’ "notFound": "Page not found", 243â†’ "unauthorized": "Unauthorized access", 244â†’ "serverError": "Server error occ ... entries.content: Let me check the localization utility that was already created:

entries.detail:
1â†’"""
     2â†’Localization utilities for translating API messages based on Accept-Language header.
     3â†’
     4â†’This module provides functions to:
     5â†’- Extract language preference from request headers
     6â†’- Translate error messages and API responses
     7â†’- Support multiple languages (currently English and Hebrew)
     8â†’"""
     9â†’
    10â†’from typing import Dict, Optional
    11â†’from fastapi import Request
    12â†’
    13â†’
    14â†’# Default translation messages
    15â†’# These will be expanded with JSON-based translation files in subtask-3-2
    16â†’DEFAULT_MESSAGES: Dict[str, Dict[str, str]] = {
    17â†’    'en': {
    18â†’        'email_already_registered': 'Email already registered',
    19â†’        'invalid_credentials': 'Invalid email or password',
    20â†’        'account_inactive': 'Account is inactive',
    21â†’        'not_authenticated': 'Not authenticated',
    22â†’        'invalid_or_expired_token': 'Invalid or expired token',
    23â†’        'user_not_found': 'User not found',
    24â†’        'user_inactive': 'User is inactive',
    25â†’        'access_denied': 'Access denied',
    26â†’        'resource_not_found': 'Resource not found',
    27â†’        'invalid_input': 'Invalid input provided',
    28â†’        'server_error': 'Internal server error occurred',
    29â†’        'unauthorized_access': 'Unauthorized access',
    30â†’        'method_not_allowed': 'Method not allowed',
    31â†’        'conflict': 'Resource conflict',
    32â†’        'validation_error': 'Validation error',
    33â†’    },
    34â†’    'he': {
    35â†’        'email_already_registered': '×”×“×•××´×œ ×›×‘×¨ ×¨×©×•×',
    36â†’        'invalid_credentials': '×“×•××´×œ ××• ×¡×™×¡××” ×œ× ×ª×§×™× ×™×',
    37â†’        'account_inactive': '×”×—×©×‘×•×Ÿ ××™× ×• ×¤×¢×™×œ',
    38â†’        'not_authenticated': '×œ× ×××•××ª',
    39â†’        'invalid_or_expired_token': '×˜×•×§×Ÿ ×œ× ×ª×§×™×Ÿ ××• ×¤×’ ×ª×•×§×£',
    40â†’        'user_not_found': '××©×ª××© ×œ× × ××¦×',
    41â†’        'user_inactive': '××©×ª××© ××™× ×• ×¤×¢×™×œ',
    42â†’        'access_denied': '×’×™×©×” × ×“×—×ª×”',
    43â†’        'resource_not_found': '×”×¨×¡×•×¨×¡ ×œ× × ××¦×',
    44â†’        'invalid_input': '×§×œ×˜ ×œ× ×ª×§×™×Ÿ',
    45â†’        'server_error': '×©×’×™××” ×‘×©×¨×ª ×¤× ×™××™×ª',
    46â†’        'unauthorized_access': '×’×™×©×” ×œ× ××•×¨×©×™×ª',
    47â†’        'method_not_allowed': '×©×™×˜×” ×œ× ××•×ª×¨×ª',
    48â†’        'conflict': '× ×™×’×•×“ ××©××‘×™×',
    49â†’        'validation_error': '×©×’×™××ª ×ª×™×§×•×£',
    50â†’    }
    51â†’}
    52â†’
    53â†’# Supported languages
    54â†’SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES = ['en', 'he']
    55â†’DEFAULT_LANGUAGE = 'en'
    56â†’
    57â†’
    58â†’def parse_accept_language_header(accept_language: str) -> str:
    59â†’    """
    60â†’    Parse Accept-Language header to extract the primary language code.
    61â†’
    62â†’    Args:
    63â†’        accept_language: The Accept-Language header value (e.g., 'he-IL,he;q=0.9,en;q=0.8')
    64â†’
    65â†’    Returns:
    66â†’        Language code (e.g., 'he', 'en'). Returns 'en' if unable to parse.
    67â†’    """
    68â†’    if not accept_language:
    69â†’        return DEFAULT_LANGUAGE
    70â†’
    71â†’    # Split by comma to get language preferences
    72â†’    languages = accept_language.split(',')
    73â†’    for lang_pref in languages:
    74â†’        # Split by semicolon to separate language from quality factor
    75â†’        lang_code = lang_pref.split(';')[0].strip()
    76â†’        # Get the primary language code (before '-' in cases like 'he-IL')
    77â†’        primary_lang = lang_code.split('-')[0].lower()
    78â†’        # Return the first supported language found
    79â†’        if primary_lang in SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES:
    80â†’            return primary_lang
    81â†’
    82â†’    return DEFAULT_LANGUAGE
    83â†’
    84â†’
    85â†’def get_language_from_request(request: Request) -> str:
    86â†’    """
    87â†’    Extract the user's preferred language from the request.
    88â†’
    89â†’    First checks the Accept-Language header, then falls back to default language.
    90â†’
    91â†’    Args:
    92â†’        request: FastAPI Request object
    93â†’
    94â†’    Returns:
    95â†’        Language code ('en' or 'he')
    96â†’    """
    97â†’    accept_language = request.headers.get('Accept-Language', DEFAULT_LANGUAGE)
    98â†’    return parse_accept_language_header(accept_language)
    99â†’
   100â†’
   101â†’def translate_message(message_key: str, language: str, messages: Optional[Dict[str, Dict[str, str]]] = None) -> str:
   102â†’    """
   103â†’    Translate a message key to the specified language.
   104â†’
   105â†’    Falls back to English if the key is not found in the specified language.
   106â†’    If the language is not supported, uses English as fallback.
   107â†’
   108â†’    Args:
   109â†’        message_key: The translation key (e.g., 'email_already_registered')
   110â†’        language: Language code ('en' or 'he')
   111â†’        messages: Optional custom messages dictionary. Uses DEFAULT_MESSAGES if not provided.
   112â†’
   113â†’    Returns:
   114â†’        Translated message string, or the key itself if translation not found
   115â†’    """
   116â†’    if messages is None:
   117â†’        messages = DEFAULT_MESSAGES
   118â†’
   119â†’    # Normalize language to supported languages
   120â†’    if language not in SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES:
   121â†’        language = DEFAULT_LANGUAGE
   122â†’
   123â†’    # Try to get translation in requested language
   124â†’    if language in messages and message_key in messages[language]:
   125â†’        return messages[language][message_key]
   126â†’
   127â†’    # Fallback to English if key not found in requested language
   128â†’    if message_key in messages[DEFAULT_LANGUAGE]:
   129â†’        return messages[DEFAULT_LANGUAGE][message_key]
   130â†’
   131â†’    # Return the key itself if no translation found
   132â†’    return message_key
   133â†’
   134â†’
   135â†’def get_error_message(message_key: str, request: Request, messages: Optional[Dict[str, Dict[str, str]]] = None) -> str:
   136â†’    """
   137â†’    Get an error message translated to the user's preferred language from request.
   138â†’
   139â†’    Convenience function that combines language detection and translation.
   140â†’
   141â†’    Args:
   142â†’        message_key: The translation key for the error message
   143â†’        request: FastAPI Request object
   144â†’        messages: Optional custom messages dictionary
   145â†’
   146â†’    Returns:
   147â†’        Translated error message
   148â†’    """
   149â†’    language = get_language_from_request(request)
   150â†’    return translate_message(message_key, language, messages)
   151â†’
   152â†’
   153â†’def is_language_supported(language: str) -> bool:
   154â†’    """
   155â†’    Check if a language is supported.
   156â†’
   157â†’    Args:
   158â†’        language: Language code to check
   159â†’
   160â†’    Returns:
   161â†’        True if language is supported, False otherwise
   162â†’    """
   163â†’    return language.lower() in SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES
   164â†’

entries.content:
Perfect! I have successfully completed **subtask-3-2: Create translation dictionaries for backend error messages and API responses**.

## Summary of Work Completed

### Files Created:
1. **`./backend/app/locales/en.json`** - English translation dictionary (3.0KB)
2. **`./backend/app/locales/he.json`** - Hebrew translation dictionary (3.6KB)

### Translation Coverage:
The translation dictionaries provide comprehensive message coverage across the following categories:

- **Authentication** (8 keys) - Email registration, credentials validation, token management
- **Users** (6 keys) - User not found, profile management, language preferences
- **Authorization** (4 keys) - Access control and permission management
- **Resources** (11 keys) - All domain entities (projects, equipment, materials, meetings, approvals, areas, contacts, files, checklists, audit logs)
- **Validation** (7 keys) - Input validation and format checking
- **Database** (4 keys) - Database operations and conflict handling
- **Files** (4 keys) - File upload and handling operations
- **Server** (6 keys) - Server errors and service availability
- **Operations** (6 keys) - Success and failure messages for CRUD operations

**Total:** 56 translation keys with complete English and Hebrew translations

### Quality Checks:
âœ… Both JSON files are valid and properly formatted  
âœ… All keys exist in both English and Hebrew files  
âœ… Verification command passes: `test -f ./backend/app/locales/en.json && test -f ./backend/app/locales/he.json && echo 'OK'`  
âœ… Changes committed to git with descriptive message  
âœ… Subtask status updated to "completed"

The translation dictionaries are now ready to be integrated with the localization utility module (already created in subtask-3-1) for use throughout the backend API for localizing error messages and responses based on the Accept-Language header.
I'll start by checking my current directory and reading the specification files to understand the task.

1â†’# Specification: Translate Product to Hebrew 2â†’ 3â†’## Overview 4â†’ 5â†’This task involves implementing comprehensive Hebrew language support for the entire product, including the React frontend UI, backend API responses, and error messages. The implementation will establish a full internationalization (i18n) infrastructure using industry-standard tools, enabling the application to serve Hebrew-speaking users with proper right-to-left (RTL) layout support. This is a foundational feature that enables language localization and sets up the architecture for future language additions. 6â†’ 7â†’## Workflow Type 8â†’ 9â†’**Type**: feature 10â†’ 11â†’**Rationale**: This is a new feature implementation that adds internationalization infrastructure and Hebrew language support to the product. It requires changes across multiple services (frontend and backend), introduces new dependencies, modifies component rendering, and establishes patterns for future localization work. 12â†’ 13â†’## Task Scope 14â†’ 15â†’### Services Involved 16â†’- **frontend** (primary) - React application with all UI components, dialogs, forms, and user-facing text 17â†’- **backend** (secondary) - FastAPI application for translating API error messages and response content 18â†’ 19â†’### This Task Will: 20â†’- [ ] Install and configure i18next internationalization framework in frontend 21â†’- [ ] Create Hebrew translation files for all UI strings, labels, buttons, placeholders 22â†’- [ ] Extract all hardcoded English strings from React components 23â†’- [ ] Implement RTL (right-to-left) support for Hebrew layout 24â†’- [ ] Configure language switching mechanism in the application 25â†’- [ ] Create backend translation endpoints or response localization layer 26â†’- [ ] Add Hebrew language option to user preferences/settings 27â†’- [ ] Verify all Material-UI components respect RTL direction 28â†’- [ ] Test date, time, number, and currency formatting for Hebrew locale 29â†’ 30â†’### Out of Scope: 31â†’- Translation of documentation or internal README files 32â†’- Marketing website content (if separate from product) 33â†’- Mobile app support (unless part of this product) 34â†’- Other language support beyond Hebrew (future feature) 35â†’- Profiling or optimization of i18n performance 36â†’- Cloud-based translation management tools (Crowdin, Lokalise) - using local JSON files 37â†’- Voice/audio content translation 38â†’ 39â†’## Service Context 40â†’ 41â†’### Frontend Service 42â†’ 43â†’**Tech Stack:** 44â†’- Language: TypeScript 45â†’- Framework: React 46â†’- Build Tool: Vite 47â†’- CSS-in-JS: Emotion 48â†’- UI Library: Material-UI (@mui/material) 49â†’- HTTP Client: axios 50â†’- Router: react-router-dom 51â†’ 52â†’**Key Directories:** 53â†’- `./frontend/src` - Main source code 54â†’- `./frontend/src/components` - React components (primary target for extraction) 55â†’- `./frontend/src/pages` - Page components 56â†’- `./frontend/src/App.tsx` - Main app component (entry point) 57â†’ 58â†’**Entry Point:** `./frontend/src/App.tsx` 59â†’ 60â†’**How to Run:** 61â†’```bash 62â†’cd frontend 63â†’npm install 64â†’npm run dev 65â†’``` 66â†’ 67â†’**Port:** 3000 68â†’ 69â†’### Backend Service 70â†’ 71â†’**Tech Stack:** 72â†’- Language: Python 73â†’- Framework: FastAPI 74â†’- ORM: SQLAlchemy 75â†’- Task Queue: Celery 76â†’- Database: PostgreSQL 77â†’- Auth: JWT (python-jose) 78â†’ 79â†’**Key Directories:** 80â†’- `./backend/app` - Application code 81â†’- `./backend/app/api/v1` - API routes (contains ~58 routes) 82â†’- `./backend/app/models` - Data models 83â†’ 84â†’**Entry Point:** `./backend/app/main.py` 85â†’ 86â†’**How to Run:** 87â†’```bash 88â†’cd backend 89â†’pip install -r requirements.txt 90â†’uvicorn app.main:app --reload 91â†’``` 92â†’ 93â†’**Port:** 8000 94â†’ 95â†’## Files to Modify 96â†’ 97â†’| File | Service | What to Change | 98â†’|------|---------|---------------| 99â†’| `./frontend/src/App.tsx` | frontend | Import i18next configuration, configure language provider, apply RTL direction | 100â†’| `./frontend/src/main.tsx` or entry file | frontend | Initialize i18next before app render | 101â†’| `./frontend/src/components/**/*.tsx` | frontend | Replace hardcoded strings with i18n.t() calls | 102â†’| `./frontend/src/pages/**/*.tsx` | frontend | Replace hardcoded strings with i18n.t() calls | 103â†’| `./frontend/package.json` | frontend | Add i18next, react-i18next, i18next-browser-languagedetector dependencies | 104â†’| `./frontend/src/i18n/locales/en.json` | frontend | Create English translation file (baseline) | 105â†’| `./frontend/src/i18n/locales/he.json` | frontend | Create Hebrew translation file | 106â†’| `./frontend/src/i18n/config.ts` | frontend | NEW - Create i18next configuration file | 107â†’| `./frontend/src/theme.ts` or emotion config | frontend | Configure RTL direction support for Emotion theming | 108â†’| `./frontend/public/locales/en/translation.json` | frontend | OPTIONAL - Public locales structure (alternative approach) | 109â†’| `./frontend/public/locales/he/translation.json` | frontend | OPTIONAL - Hebrew translations in public folder | 110â†’| `./backend/app/config.py` or settings | backend | Add available languages configuration | 111â†’| `./backend/app/main.py` | backend | Add Accept-Language header handling middleware | 112â†’| `./backend/app/api/v1/auth.py` | backend | Add user language preference to user model/response | 113â†’| `./backend/app/utils/localization.py` | backend | NEW - Create backend localization utility | 114â†’| `./backend/locales/en.json` | backend | Create English API message translations | 115â†’| `./backend/locales/he.json` | backend | Create Hebrew API message translations | 116â†’ 117â†’## Files to Reference 118â†’ 119â†’These files show patterns to follow and demonstrate existing component structures: 120â†’ 121â†’| File | Pattern to Copy | 122â†’|------|----------------| 123â†’| `./frontend/src/components/**/*.tsx` | React component structure and useState/useContext patterns | 124â†’| `./frontend/src/pages/**/*.tsx` | Page-level component composition and layout patterns | 125â†’| `./backend/app/api/v1/*.py` | FastAPI route structure and response formatting | 126â†’| `./backend/app/models/*.py` | SQLAlchemy model patterns | 127â†’| `./package.json` | Dependency management and script patterns | 128â†’ 129â†’## Patterns to Follow 130â†’ 131â†’### Pattern 1: i18next Configuration & React Integration 132â†’ 133â†’From similar React i18n implementations: 134â†’ 135â†’```typescript 136â†’import i18n from 'i18next'; 137â†’import { initReactI18next } from 'react-i18next'; 138â†’import LanguageDetector from 'i18next-browser-languagedetector'; 139â†’import enTranslations from './locales/en.json'; 140â†’import heTranslations from './locales/he.json'; 141â†’ 142â†’i18n 143â†’ .use(LanguageDetector) 144â†’ .use(initReactI18next) 145â†’ .init({ 146â†’ resources: { 147â†’ en: { translation: enTranslations }, 148â†’ he: { translation: heTranslations } 149â†’ }, 150â†’ fallbackLng: 'en', 151â†’ interpolation: { 152â†’ escapeValue: false 153â†’ }, 154â†’ detection: { 155â†’ order: ['localStorage', 'navigator'], 156â†’ caches: ['localStorage'] 157â†’ } 158â†’ }); 159â†’ 160â†’export default i18n; 161â†’``` 162â†’ 163â†’**Key Points:** 164â†’- Use `i18next-browser-languagedetector` to auto-detect user's browser language 165â†’- Store language preference in localStorage for persistence 166â†’- Set fallback to English if locale not found 167â†’- Initialize before React app renders 168â†’ 169â†’### Pattern 2: Using i18n in React Components 170â†’ 171â†’From typical React component patterns with i18n: 172â†’ 173â†’```typescript 174â†’import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'; 175â†’ 176â†’function MyComponent() { 177â†’ const { t, i18n } = useTranslation(); 178â†’ 179â†’ return ( 180â†’
181â†’

{t('page.title')}

182â†’ 183â†’

{t('common.welcome', { name: 'User' })}

184â†’
185â†’ ); 186â†’} 187â†’``` 188â†’ 189â†’**Key Points:** 190â†’- Use `useTranslation()` hook in functional components 191â†’- Access `i18n` object to check current language or change language 192â†’- Use dot notation for nested translations (e.g., `page.title`) 193â†’- Support interpolation for dynamic values (e.g., `{ name: 'User' }`) 194â†’ 195â†’### Pattern 3: RTL (Right-to-Left) Support with Material-UI 196â†’ 197â†’From Material-UI RTL documentation: 198â†’ 199â†’```typescript 200â†’import { ThemeProvider, createTheme } from '@mui/material/styles'; 201â†’ 202â†’const theme = createTheme({ 203â†’ direction: i18n.language === 'he' ? 'rtl' : 'ltr', 204â†’ // ... other theme properties 205â†’}); 206â†’ 207â†’// In component: 208â†’ 209â†’ 210â†’ 211â†’``` 212â†’ 213â†’**Key Points:** 214â†’- Set `direction` property in Material-UI theme based on current language 215â†’- Material-UI components automatically mirror when `direction: 'rtl'` 216â†’- Must set document direction: `document.dir = 'rtl'` or `document.dir = 'ltr'` 217â†’- Margins and padding automatically reverse for RTL 218â†’ 219â†’### Pattern 4: Translation File Structure 220â†’ 221â†’JSON translation file structure: 222â†’ 223â†’```json 224â†’{ 225â†’ "common": { 226â†’ "welcome": "Welcome", 227â†’ "goodbye": "Goodbye", 228â†’ "submit": "Submit" 229â†’ }, 230â†’ "buttons": { 231â†’ "save": "Save", 232â†’ "cancel": "Cancel", 233â†’ "delete": "Delete" 234â†’ }, 235â†’ "pages": { 236â†’ "home": { 237â†’ "title": "Home Page", 238â†’ "description": "Welcome to our application" 239â†’ } 240â†’ }, 241â†’ "errors": { 242â†’ "notFound": "Page not found", 243â†’ "unauthorized": "Unauthorized access", 244â†’ "serverError": "Server error occ ... 1â†’from fastapi import FastAPI
     2â†’from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
     3â†’from app.config import get_settings
     4â†’from app.api.v1.router import api_router
     5â†’
     6â†’settings = get_settings()
     7â†’
     8â†’app = FastAPI(
     9â†’    title=settings.app_name,
    10â†’    openapi_url=f"{settings.api_v1_prefix}/openapi.json",
    11â†’    docs_url=f"{settings.api_v1_prefix}/docs",
    12â†’)
    13â†’
